newsitem.title: USA: CenterPoint to record deferred revenue.
newsitem.headline: CenterPoint to record deferred revenue.

text.p: CenterPoint Properties Corp said it expects to record certain revenues in the first and second quarters of 1997 that it deferred from the 1996 fourth quarter, though it would not quantify the amount.

The real estate investment trust, which on Thursday reported improved fourth-quarter and full-year funds from operations, said it experienced a spike in fee income in the quarter from the unexpected large profit realized in the sale of the O'Hare Express Center's Building A-1 to its tenant.
CenterPoint said the $2.4 million in development fees has permitted it company to assume a conservative position in terms of reserves.

The company also said it expects a modest decline in gross absorption (a measure of people moving in or out of buildings) this year in the Chicago metropolitan area to a range of 28 to 32 million square feet. This compares with 37 million square feet in 1996.
For this reason, CenterPoint said it avoids speculative development, noting that in almost all cases the potential risks are not justified by the potential rewards.
Earlier, CenterPoint reported fourth-quarter funds from operations per fully diluted share rose to $0.52 from $0.46 a year ago.
